v.v: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
If anyone tries to speak with you, will you be impatient?
See, you have instructed many;
Your words have supported him who was falling;
But now trouble has come to you, and you are weary;
Is not your fear your confidence,
Think about this, please: Who has ever perished when innocent?
According to what I have seen, those who plow iniquity
By the breath of God they perish;
The roaring of the lion, the voice of the fierce lion,
The old lion perishes for lack of victims;
Now a certain matter was secretly brought to me,
Then came thoughts from visions in the night,
It was at night when fear and trembling came upon me,
Then a spirit passed before my face,
The spirit stood still, but I could not discern its appearance.
“Can a mortal man be more righteous than God?
See, if God puts no trust in his servants;
how much more is this true of those who live in houses of clay,
Between morning and evening they are destroyed;
Are not their tent cords plucked up among them?

v: But who can stop himself from speaking?
you have strengthened weak hands.
you have made feeble knees firm.
it touches you, and you are troubled.
and the integrity of your ways your hope?
Or when were the upright people ever cut off?
and sow trouble reap it.
by the blast of his anger they are consumed.
the teeth of the young lions—they are broken.
the cubs of the lioness are scattered everywhere.
and my ear received a whisper about it.
when deep sleep falls on people.
and all my bones shook.
and the hair of my flesh stood up.
A form was before my eyes;
there was silence, and I heard a voice that said,
Can a man be more pure than his Maker?
if he accuses his angels of folly,
whose foundation is in the dust,
who are crushed sooner than a moth?
they perish forever without anyone noticing them.
They die; they die without wisdom.
